articles.title: Kim Jong Un Inspects February 20 Factory of KPA
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Inspects February 20 Factory of KPA
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army (KPA), visited the February 20 Factory of the KPA.
					 This factory has a total floor space of 109,000 square meters. It is a comprehensive foodstuff processing base capable of producing varieties of foodstuff including soy, bean paste, seasoning, table oil, butter and confectionary and processing cereals at the same time.
					
					 Kim Jong Un was briefed on the monument to the on-the-spot instructions of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il standing at the entrance to the factory before looking round the room devoted to the education in revolutionary relics and the room dedicated to its history.
					
					 He said this factory was associated with a lot of immortal leadership feats of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He highly appreciated successes registered by the party members and workers of the factory in the past.
					
					 He learned in detail about production at the factory, making the rounds of its various places including seasoning shop, essential foodstuff shops No. 1 and No. 2, butter shop, instant rice shop, combined processing shop and products show room. 
					
					 He asked about technical specifications and production capacity of equipment one by one, while being briefed on the shops before a map showing them.
					
					 He paid deep attention to the composition rate and fermentation process of raw materials for producing essential foodstuff, color of soy and bean paste and normal fineness of seasoning and packing process.
					
					 At the butter shop he asked about what kind of ingredient is used. Walking between machines in the instant rice shop, he learned about how rice is cooked. He saw non-staple food to be contained in the instant rice to be eaten by soldiers.
					
					 Making the round of the combined processing shop, he tasted biscuit and learned in detail about the quantity of meat to be put into canned goods and the method of measuring them.
					
					 Walking the compound of the factory, he saw it clad in thick verdure of tall dawn redwoods and trees of other species. He praised it as the factory where cultured practices are established in production and life as its compound looks like a park. 
					
					 He also dropped in at the canteen run by the factory to learn about service to the workers.
					
					 The most important task facing the factory is to update its equipment and put the production processes on an automatic basis as required by the new century, he said, adding that by doing so it is possible to keep the production going at a high rate and fully ensure sanitary safety of foodstuff while saving manpower. 
					
					 Underscoring the need for the officials of the factory to properly work out a business and management strategy and steadily improve the way of operation and management, he called for storing sufficient quantities of ingredients of foodstuff and steadily raising the technical skills and sense of responsibility of its employees so that quality of foodstuff may be improved.
					
					 He had a picture taken with the employees of the factory.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, and Jon Chang Bok, first vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Japanese Cabinet Official
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Japanese Cabinet Official
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Isao Iijima, special counselor in charge of crisis management in Abe's Cabinet of Japan, and his companion at the Mansudae Assembly Hall  on Thursday.

articles.title: Japanese Cabinet Official Visits Various Places Here
articles.content:
Japanese Cabinet Official Visits Various Places Here
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Isao Iijima, special counselor in charge of crisis management in Abe's Cabinet of Japan, and his companion visited the Pyongyang Folklore Park.
					 They went round various places of the park indicative of long history and culture of the Korean nation.
					
					 They also visited the Rungna Dolphinarium and the People's Open-air Ice Rink.

articles.title: Gem Sculpture "Chollima Statue", Gift from Chinese Company
articles.content:
Gem Sculpture "Chollima Statue", Gift from Chinese Company
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- On display at the International Friendship Exhibition House in the DPRK is a gem sculpture "Chollima (250 mile-a-day horse) Statue", a gift presented to leader Kim Jong Il by a Chinese international tourist agency in August Juche 85 (1996).
					 Officials of the agency frequently toured the DPRK together with tourist groups and witnessed great progress made by the DPRK under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Out of profound reverence for Kim Jong Il, they prepared the gift and presented it to him when they visited Pyongyang on the occasion of the DPRK's Youth Day.
					
					 The sculpture portrays Chollima taking a leap with wings stretched out. Reflected in it is the agency employees' wish that the Korean people would speed up socialist construction in the Chollima spirit and vigor, true to the noble intention of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: National Sports Contest of School Youth Opens
articles.content:
National Sports Contest of School Youth Opens
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- The 39th National Schoolchildren's Sports Contest for Jongilbong Prize opened in the DPRK. 
					 It brought together more than 9,000 school youth and children selected from each province of the country. It will be held in Pyongyang, Phyongsong and Hamhung cities.
					
					 The contest was divided into groups of senior secondary and junior secondary and primary schools. The participants will compete in 40 odd events including defence sports, basketball, volleyball, table tennis, Taekwon-Do, marathon and wrestling. 
					
					 An opening ceremony took place at the Taekwon-Do Hall Thursday.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony there was a Taekwon-Do demonstration performance of schoolchildren.

articles.title: Int'l Workshop on Organic Agriculture Held
articles.content:
Int'l Workshop on Organic Agriculture Held
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- An international workshop on organic agriculture took place at the Pyongyang Centre for Cultural Exchange with Foreign Countries from Tuesday to Thursday.
					 Present there were Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and director of the Pyongyang International New Technological and Economic Information Exchange Agency, officials of ministries and national institutions, officials and researchers in the field of scientific research and agricultural experts.
					
					 Members of the delegation of the International Federation of Organic Agriculture Movements headed by President Andre Frederick Leu attended.
					
					 There were lectures under several titles including "Fertility of soil in organic agriculture", "Green manure", "Multi-functional benefits of organic agriculture, soil health and nutrition" and "Humus soil and its making".
					
					 A practical workshop took place at the Ssangun Organic Agriculture Experiment Station in South Phyongan Province. Its participants exchanged successes and experience achieved in disseminating the know-how of organic agriculture.

articles.title: DPRK's Lifts Trophy at International Art Olympic
articles.content:
DPRK's Lifts Trophy at International Art Olympic
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- DPRK's student Paek Sun Mi took first place at the 3rd International Art Olympics held in Moscow on May 9 and 10. She is a student of Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory.
					 This Olympics has been held since 2010 to find out and put forward art talents, educate the rising generations in the spirit of patriotism, widely disseminate historical and cultural legacies and boost the cultural exchange and cooperation among various countries in the world.
					
					 It brought together more than 250 students from the DPRK, Russia, Belarus and Kazakhstan. It was divided into various panels including vocal music, instrumental music, poem composition and fine arts.
					
					 The instrumental music was graded by single appraisement on the play of musical instruments including bayan, piano, violin, cello, accordion and wind instrument.
					
					 By giving excellent bayan rendition of the Korean song "General on a Galloping White Horse" and various foreign songs, Paek was honored with International Art Olympic laurel, winning high appraisement in her debut.
					
					 At a closing ceremony on May 10, she was awarded with a diploma of the first grade, a cup and a medal.

articles.title: Military Analyst Censures US Reckless Nuclear Blackmail
articles.content:
Military Analyst Censures US Reckless Nuclear Blackmail
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is escalating confrontation with the DPRK with reckless nuclear blackmail, making a mockery of the army and people of the DPRK, says a military analyst in an article of Rodong Sinmun Thursday.
					 The U.S. that seeks aggression and domination has turned the Korean Peninsula into a field for training nuclear war technique and a ground for testing cutting-edge weapons of mass destruction, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. recently instigated the south Korean military to stage a series of war exercises in the waters off the peninsula.
					
					 The firepower test conducted by the U.S. carrier, in particular, was a military movement rare to be seen even in a region where a war is imminent. 
					
					 Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises which started in March were the greatest nuclear blackmail aimed to turn the DPRK, a nuclear weapons state, into a non-nuclear one.
					
					 The U.S.-south Korea joint naval war exercises in the East, West and South seas of Korea were an extension of military offensive for invading the DPRK, pursuant to the policy of stifling it.
					
					 The U.S. is now focusing all efforts on its policy toward the DPRK the ultimate purpose of which is aggression and domination.
					
					 The U.S. contemplates preempting a strike through the mobilization of all its nuclear and other military capabilities. This compels the DPRK to counter the U.S. with its own nukes. This is the true picture of the nuclear confrontation between the DPRK and the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. prides itself on nuclear hardware including Nimitz. But the bigger the targets are, the easier it becomes to destroy.
					
					 The DPRK sees the controversy over the satellite observation data about the movement of missile Musudan as a one-sided thought.
					
					 The DPRK, a full-fledged nuclear weapons state, does not evade the nuclear confrontation with the American empire.
					
					 There is a limit to the restraints and patience of the DPRK. The strongholds of the brigandish U.S. imperialists top the list of the DPRK's ICBM targets and the Strategic Rocket Force of the Korean People's Army is waiting for an order of launch.
					
					 Victory is in store for the DPRK in the unavoidable do-or-die battle with the U.S. imperialists that will flare up any day.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive's Apology Dismissed as Deceptive
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive's Apology Dismissed as Deceptive
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Kyunghyang Daily News in an article on May 13 decried the apology made by the present chief executive of south Korea.
					 The chief executive at a meeting of senior secretaries of Chongwadae made an apology for the sexual scandal in which the spokesman for Chongwadae was involved during her recent trip to the U.S., the article recalled, adding:
					
					 Big problem is that it fell short of the expectation of south Koreans and there was no self-communion.
					
					 The scandal was supposed since the controversial appointment of Yun Chang Jung as spokesman for Chongwadae.
					
					 The chief executive, therefore, should have admitted it first and apologized for it not at an internal meeting of Chongwadae but in a statement for the people or at a formal press conference.
					
					 The article blamed Chongwadae for getting engaged in heated-up debate on the responsibility for the scandal.
					
					 It urged the "government" to take practical measures after admitting the existence of the problem in itself.

articles.title: S. Korean Radio Decries Chongwadae Spokesman's Sex Scandal
articles.content:
S. Korean Radio Decries Chongwadae Spokesman's Sex Scandal
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- South Korean internet radio Voice of People made public an article on May 14 as regards the sexual scandal that occurred in the period of the south Korean chief executive's visit to the U.S.
					 The article said:
					
					 Although Yun Chang Jung, spokesman for Chongwadae, is dismissed from Chongwadae as a result of the recent sexual scandal, many other Yuns will appear.
					
					 The present "government" is characterized by the formation with blind followers to Park Chung-Hee's "yusin" dictatorship.
					
					 Park privatized the power. Its most typical example is that he called famous entertainers each night by mobilizing the "presidential" guards and the Central Intelligence Agency. If the Yun's act is an "unpardonable one unbecoming for a public official" as described by the "president", what her father had done must be serious criminal acts. Yun's act can be seen as a light crime when compared with those.
					
					 Father's criminal acts are justified by his followers and his daughter has now seized power with the clout of backstage power. So, words covering Yun's deeds are not accidental.
					
					 Although Yun was dismissed from Chongwadae, the present situation will recur unless the "president" changes all those in her list.
					
					 The politics dominating the people will be judged by them for sure.
					
					 Noting that Yun is not a "monster" who was appointed accidentally, the article added that the present chief executive of south Korea is among those "monsters".

articles.title: Those Related to Minchonghakryon Case Given Verdict of Not Guilty
articles.content:
Those Related to Minchonghakryon Case Given Verdict of Not Guilty
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- The Seoul High Court of South Korea gave a verdict of not guilty to four persons including a teacher of Sogang University who were punished on charges of the involvement in the case of the Minchonghakryon (National Democratic Youths and Students League) during the period of the past fascist dictatorship.
					 In 1974 the fascist clique took them to the puppet Central Intelligence Agency and the police without warrants of arrest on charges of taking the lead in the struggle for having the "yusin constitution" rescinded and "emergency step" lifted. They put those to harsh torture and sentenced them to prison terms, ten years to the maximum.
					
					 The Seoul High Court gave the verdict of not guilty to them, declaring the "emergency step" No. 1, which was cited as the reason for sentencing them and which encroached upon the people's basic rights, as illegal and invalid. The court admitted that their activities are not crimes.

articles.title: Overseas Korean Calls for Probing Truth behind Fraud-marred Election
articles.content:
Overseas Korean Calls for Probing Truth behind Fraud-marred Election
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- An organization of overseas compatriots presented a document to the U.N. on May 14. It was formed to probe the truth behind the conservatives' irregularities in the south Korean "presidential" election.
					 The organization said the 18th-term "presidential" election in south Korea was an illegal and fraud-tainted election as the Intelligence Service took an active hand in an organized way by dint of power and the central election administration committee reneged on the promise to maintain political neutrality.
					
					 South Korean society connived at the despicable crime aimed to misguide the people's psychology with the use of the intelligence organ. Therefore, it has become impossible to probe the truth behind the fraud-tainted election, it noted.
					
					 The organization issued several statements through south Korean and overseas Koreans' media in order to bring the public to the knowledge of the unjust nature of the election and the truth about illegal actions committed by power organs including the Intelligence Service. It also conducted activities to probe the truth. Overseas Koreans residing in different parts of the world positively joined in the action, it noted, adding:
					
					 The irregularities in the election are attributable to the regime, which took control of all organs including media by posting its close confidants to the seats of power.
					
					 The organization called on the U.N. to properly understand it and come out to probe the truth.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Report Introduced by Lao Newspaper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Report Introduced by Lao Newspaper
 Pyongyang, March 16 (KCNA) -- The Lao newspaper Congtap Pasason Lao posted the detailed gist of the historic report made by the dear respected Kim Jong Un at the March, 2013 Plenary Meeting of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) on its website on May 10.
					 The report made by him on March 31, Juche 102 (2013) sets forth a new strategic line on simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the building of nuclear force as demanded by the prevailing situation and development of the Korean revolution. The report also indicates tasks and ways for its implementation.
					
					 The newspaper carried his photo.

articles.title: Bangladeshi, French Bodies Introduce Pyongyang Folklore Park
articles.content:
Bangladeshi, French Bodies Introduce Pyongyang Folklore Park
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Bangladeshi and French organizations introduced the Pyongyang Folklore Park.
					 The Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy in its bulletin on May 8 elaborated on the park, saying it vividly shows the 5,000 year-long history, culture and traditions of the Korean nation.
					
					 Also posted on the websites of the France-Korea Friendship Association, the French Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Songun Idea and the Anti-Imperialist Front of France are articles illustrated with photos of the park on May 9.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con Isao Iijima y su comitiva
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con Isao Iijima y su comitiva
Pyongyang, 16 de mayo (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia 16 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con Isao Iijima, consejero especial encargado del manejo de crisis en el gabinete japones de Abe, y su comitiva.

articles.title: Perspectivas de ZIK y relaciones N-S dependen de autoridades surcoreanas: BGDCDZE
articles.content:
Perspectivas de ZIK y relaciones N-S dependen de autoridades surcoreanas: BGDCDZE
Pyongyang, 16 de mayo (ACNC) -- En estos dias, las autoridades surcoreanas estan acusando atrevidamente a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en el tema de la Zona Industrial de Kaesong (ZIK).
					En entrevista con la ACNC, el portavoz del Buro General de Direccion Central sobre el Desarrollo de Zona Especial (BGDCDZE) dio el dia 15 la respuesta.
					
					En vez de prestar debida atencion a los problemas relacionados con la situacion de la ZIK y de esforzarse por normalizar su operacion, las autoridades surcoreanas se portan mal acusando a la RPDC sin motivos justos.
					
					Asi quieren eludir la responsabilidad por el actual estado de la ZIK y enganar la opinion publica, senala la nota y prosigue:
					
					Ademas de aplacar el descontento de empresas medianas y pequenas y atenuar las criticas del pueblo surcoreano, ellas pretenden distraer la atencion de la opinion publica interna y externa, irritada por el caso de escandalo sexual de Yun Chang Jung nunca visto en la historia internacional de diplomacia, y "cambiar la coyuntura" tras reponerse de la deshonra.
					
					Esta vez, la gobernante surcoreana instruyo proponer el dialogo al Norte (de Corea) por una parte y por la otra, dijo que "la ZIK no necesita la simple normalizacion sino un cambio innovador para internacionalizacion", "el Norte de Corea debe cumplir la promesa hecha con la sociedad internacional y debe ser garantizado el aparato de seguridad para la reforma", etc.
					
					Es otro disparate provocativo contra la RPDC.
					
					Si uno quiere proponer el dialogo, no debe faltar a la cortesia basica.
					
					En la propuesta anterior del dialogo, habia lanzado el "ultimatum" de que si la RPDC no da la repuesta hasta las 12:00 del dia siguiente, tomaria una medida importante. Y esta vez, al cabo de criticar mucho a la RPDC, planteo la "internacionalizacion", el "aparato de seguridad" y otras cosas absurdas.
					
					No se puede pensar en la "internacionalizacion" de esa zona de desarrollo economico comun de la nacion, construida segun el espiritu del 15 de Junio.
					
					Para colmo, el "aparato de seguridad" y otros embustes significan dichos conflictivos que suponen el caso de "rehen" y "retencion".
					
					El actual "poder" surcoreano recurre con frenesi a las maniobras de guerra nuclear de agresion a la RPDC introduciendo el portaaviones desde el territorio de Estados Unidos y expone mas abiertamente el intento de mellar y aplastar la RPDC en contubernio con su amo norteamericano. Por eso, la RPDC esta examinando si debe establecer relaciones con el actual "poder" surcoreano y puede resolver algo con el.
					
					Si la parte surcoreana desea de veras la normalizacion de las labores de la ZIK, no debe hablar de los problemas no esenciales como comunicacion y salida de materiales sino solucionar los problemas principales y abstenerse de actos provocativos y palabras conflictivas contra la RPDC.
					
					Aprovechamos esta oportunidad para recordarles una vez mas a las autoridades surcoreanas que el futuro de la ZIK y el posterior rumbo de las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas dependen de la actitud de ellas.

articles.title: Tiene lugar cursillo internacional de agricultura organica
articles.content:
Tiene lugar cursillo internacional de agricultura organica
Pyongyang, 16 de mayo (ACNC) -- Se impartio desde el dia 14 al 16 en el Centro de Intercambio Cultural con el Extranjero de Pyongyang el cursillo internacional de agricultura organica. 
					Participaron Kim Jin Bom, vicepresidente del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero y consejero de la Agencia Internacional de Intercambio de Informacion de Nueva Tecnologia y Economia de Pyongyang, los funcionarios e investigadores de ministerios, organos centrales y de la rama de investigacion cientifica, y los especialistas en agricultura. 
					
					Tambien estuvieron presentes los miembros de la delegacion de la Federacion Internacional del Movimiento de Agricultura Organica encabezada por el presidente Andre Frederick Leu.
					
					En la ocasion hubo lecciones como "Fertilidad de tierra en la agricultura organica", "Abono verde", "Beneficios multifuncionales de la agricultura organica, la salud y nutricion de tierra", etc.
					
					Durante el cursillo tuvo lugar, en el campo experimental de agricultura organica de Ssangun de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur, el cursillo de practica y los participantes intercambiaron los exitos y experiencias alcanzados en la divulgacion de conocimientos de ese metodo agricola.

articles.title: Es intolerable chantaje nuclear de EE.UU., apunta Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Es intolerable chantaje nuclear de EE.UU., apunta Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, 16 de mayo (ACNC) -- En el articulo de un comentarista militar publicado este jueves, el diario Rodong Sinmun critico a EE.UU. que se burla del ejercito y pueblo coreanos buscando el enfrentamiento con la RPDC mediante el chantaje nuclear.
					La Peninsula Coreana se ha convertido en el campo de ejercicio de tecnicas de guerra nuclear y el de prueba de sofisticadas armas de exterminio masivo de EE.UU. que intenta la agresion y el dominio, comienza el articulo y continua:
					
					Recientemente, EE.UU. libro uno tras otro en las aguas maritimas de la Peninsula Coreana los ejercicios belicos incitando a las fuerzas militares surcoreanas.
					
					En particular, la prueba de fuego del portaaviones fue el movimiento militar dificil de ver hasta en la zona en visperas de guerra.
					
					Los ejercicios militares conjuntos "Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle" iniciados en marzo significaron el peor chantaje nuclear que persiguio la renuncia de armas nucleares por parte de la RPDC.
					
					Hoy en dia, EE.UU. se concentra en la realizacion de la politica sobre la RPDC con el proposito final de agredirla y dominarla.
					
					Puesto que el imperio intenta el ataque preventivo movilizando todas las fuerzas militares nucleares, la RPDC se vio obligada a enfrentarsele con las armas nucleares.
					
					EE.UU. se jacta de sus equipos nucleares incluyendo el portaaviones nuclear Nimitz. Pero, mientras sean mas grandes los blancos, sera mas facil atacarlos.
					
					La RPDC considera como parcial el debate sobre los datos de observacion satelital acerca del movimiento de misil "Musudan".
					
					La RPDC, digna poseedora de armas nucleares, no elude la confrontacion nuclear con el imperio americano.
					
					Hay limites tambien en la paciencia de la RPDC.
					
					Los ICBM de la RPDC toman por su primer blanco las bases de tropas agresoras yanquis y los uniformados de las fuerzas coheteriles estrategicas tienen sus manos sobre el boton de lanzamiento. Sera nuestra la victoria en el combate final con EE.UU. que vendra tarde o temprano.
